newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine Jan-Feb exports up to $3.503 bln.
newsitem.headline: Philippine Jan-Feb exports up to $3.503 bln.

text.p: Philippine merchandise exports in the first two months of the year grew by 16.2 percent to $3.503 billion from $3.014 billion in the same period in 1996, the state-agency National Statistics Office said on Saturday.
The NSO said in a statement Philippine exports for February 1997 alone reached $1.811 billion, surpassing the $1.594 billion posted in February 1996.

Exports of electronics and components last February rose by 22.1 percent to $758.45 million from $621.36 million. The sector accounted for 41.9 percent of the country's total export revenues for February, the NSO said.
The second biggest export, articles of apparel and clothing accessories, brought combined revenues of $182.32 million compared with $199.14 million last year.

Other major exports include coconut oil with $45.34 million, ignition wiring sets used in vehicles, aircraft and ships with $44.89 million, woodcraft and furniture with $39.36 million, petroleum products with $22.62 million, and metal components with $21.82 million.
Purchases made by the United States comprised the bulk of the country's export revenues last February with $651.45 million compared with the year-ago $502.18 million.
Other major buyers of Philippine exports were Japan with $324.61 million, Netherlands with $132.86 million, and Singapore with $114.9 million.
